meanings.definition: To ambush or attack someone from a hidden location.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky bandits decided to bushwhack the travelers on the forest path.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers had to bushwhack through the jungle to surprise the enemy camp.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids planned to bushwhack their friends during the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The ninja bushwhacked the enemy with swift and silent movements.
meanings.sent5: The pirates were known to bushwhack unsuspecting ships under the cover of darkness.

meanings.definition: To clear a path through dense vegetation.
meanings.sent1: We had to bushwhack our way through the thick bushes to reach the hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent2: The explorers used machetes to bushwhack a trail through the dense rainforest.
meanings.sent3: The gardener had to bushwhack the overgrown shrubs to make the garden neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully bushwhacked a path through the tangled vines blocking the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The hikers had to bushwhack through the wilderness to find the secluded lake.

meanings.sent1: The sudden bushwhack by the enemy caught the soldiers off guard.
meanings.sent2: The spy reported a possible bushwhack planned by the rival agents.
meanings.sent3: The birthday surprise turned into a fun bushwhack for the unsuspecting guest.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected bushwhack in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The legend spoke of a legendary bushwhack by the fearless warrior against a larger army.
